description: 20 prompts covering array operations: Add, Remove, Get, Contains, Length, Clear, ForEachLoop with arrays, array+branch combos, building arrays dynamically.

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with a string array Inventory. On BeginPlay add Sword to the array and print the array length.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_AddToArray
PARENT: Actor
VAR Inventory: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Inventory]
NODE n3: ArrayAdd [Item="Sword"]
NODE n4: ArrayLength
NODE n5: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.Array [Array]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Enemies. On pressing Clear, remove the first element from the array and print Removed.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RemoveFirst
PARENT: Actor
VAR Enemies: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Clear"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Enemies]
NODE n3: ArrayRemoveIndex [Index=0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Removed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Items. On BeginPlay get the element at index 0 and print it.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GetFirst
PARENT: Actor
VAR Items: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Items]
NODE n3: ArrayGet [Index=0]
NODE n4: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Tags. On BeginPlay check if Tags contains Player. If yes print Is Player. If no print Not Player.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ContainsCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR Tags: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Tags]
NODE n3: ArrayContains [Item="Player"]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Is Player"]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Not Player"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n6.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Items. On BeginPlay get array length. If length greater than 0 print Has Items. Else print Empty.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LengthCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR Items: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Items]
NODE n3: ArrayLength
NODE n4: GreaterThan [B=0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Has Items"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Empty"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n7.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Names. On BeginPlay use ForEachLoop to print every name in the array.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PrintNames
PARENT: Actor
VAR Names: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Names]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. On pressing Reset, clear the array and print Cleared.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ClearArray
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Reset"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ArrayClear
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Cleared"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Visitors. On overlap add the other actor to Visitors and print the array length.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TrackVisitors
PARENT: Actor
VAR Visitors: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Visitors]
NODE n3: ArrayAdd
NODE n4: ArrayLength
NODE n5: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Item [Actor]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.Array [Array]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Enemies. On pressing Kill, ForEachLoop through all enemies and destroy each one. After loop print All Destroyed.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Enemies: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Kill"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Enemies]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="All Destroyed"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n5.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. On BeginPlay ForEachLoop checking distance. Track closest in variable Nearest. After loop print nearest name.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FindNearest
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
VAR Nearest: Actor = None
VAR BestDist: Float = 999999.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: GetDistanceTo
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=BestDist]
NODE n6: LessThan
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: VariableSet [VarName=BestDist]
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=Nearest]
NODE n10: VariableGet [VarName=Nearest]
NODE n11: GetDisplayName
NODE n12: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.B [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n8.Value [Float]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n9.Value [Actor]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n12.Execute
DATA n10.Value -> n11.Target [Actor]
DATA n11.ReturnValue -> n12.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Quotes. On pressing Random, get array length, generate random index, get element at that index, print it.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RandomQuote
PARENT: Actor
VAR Quotes: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Random"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Quotes]
NODE n3: ArrayLength
NODE n4: RandomInteger [Min=0]
NODE n5: ArrayGet
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Max [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Index [Int]
DATA n2.Value -> n5.Array [Array]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with vector array SpawnPoints. On BeginPlay ForEachLoop spawning BP_Enemy at each point. After loop print all spawned count.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnFromArray
PARENT: Actor
VAR SpawnPoints: Array<Vector>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=SpawnPoints]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=SpawnPoints]
NODE n6: ArrayLength
NODE n7: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.SpawnTransform [Transform]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n7.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n6.Array [Array]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array TrackedActors. On overlap add actor. On end overlap remove actor from array. Print count after each change.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TrackOverlap
PARENT: Actor
VAR TrackedActors: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=TrackedActors]
NODE n3: ArrayAdd
NODE n4: ArrayLength
NODE n5: PrintString
NODE n6: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n7: VariableGet [VarName=TrackedActors]
NODE n8: ArrayRemove
NODE n9: ArrayLength
NODE n10: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Item [Actor]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.Array [Array]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.InString [String]
EXEC n6.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n6.OtherActor -> n8.Item [Actor]
DATA n7.Value -> n8.Array [Array]
EXEC n8.Then -> n10.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n9.Array [Array]
DATA n9.ReturnValue -> n10.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with int array Scores. Start a looping timer every 2 seconds. Each tick generate random 1-100 and add to Scores. Print array length. After 5 items clear timer.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TimerArray
PARENT: Actor
VAR Scores: Array<Int>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="AddScore", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=AddScore]
NODE n4: RandomInteger [Min=1, Max=100]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=Scores]
NODE n6: ArrayAdd
NODE n7: ArrayLength
NODE n8: PrintString
NODE n9: GreaterThan [B=4]
NODE n10: Branch
NODE n11: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="AddScore"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.Item [Int]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.Array [Array]
EXEC n6.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n5.Value -> n7.Array [Array]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.InString [String]
EXEC n8.Then -> n10.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n9.A [Int]
DATA n9.ReturnValue -> n10.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n10.True -> n11.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Log. On BeginPlay get array length, subtract 1, get element at that index. Print the last element.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_LastElement
PARENT: Actor
VAR Log: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Log]
NODE n3: ArrayLength
NODE n4: SubtractInt [B=1]
NODE n5: ArrayGet
NODE n6: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Index [Int]
DATA n2.Value -> n5.Array [Array]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array AllActors. On BeginPlay ForEachLoop. Check distance less than 500 for each. If close, add to a NearbyActors array. After loop print nearby count.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FilterNearby
PARENT: Actor
VAR AllActors: Array<Actor>
VAR NearbyActors: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AllActors]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: GetDistanceTo
NODE n5: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n6: Branch
NODE n7: VariableGet [VarName=NearbyActors]
NODE n8: ArrayAdd
NODE n9: VariableGet [VarName=NearbyActors]
NODE n10: ArrayLength
NODE n11: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n6.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n6.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n8.Item [Actor]
DATA n7.Value -> n8.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n11.Execute
DATA n9.Value -> n10.Array [Array]
DATA n10.ReturnValue -> n11.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with int PickupType and string array CollectedTypes. On overlap switch on PickupType. Case 1 adds Health. Case 2 adds Ammo. Case 3 adds Shield. Print array length.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TypeCollector
PARENT: Actor
VAR PickupType: Int = 1
VAR CollectedTypes: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=PickupType]
NODE n3: SwitchOnInt
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=CollectedTypes]
NODE n5: ArrayAdd [Item="Health"]
NODE n6: ArrayAdd [Item="Ammo"]
NODE n7: ArrayAdd [Item="Shield"]
NODE n8: ArrayLength
NODE n9: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Selection [Int]
EXEC n3.Case_1 -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Case_2 -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n6.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Case_3 -> n7.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n7.Array [Array]
EXEC n5.Then -> n9.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n9.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n8.Array [Array]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Queue. On pressing Next, check if array length equals 0. If empty print Queue Empty. If not, get first element, remove index 0, print the element name.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_QueueProcess
PARENT: Actor
VAR Queue: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Next"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Queue]
NODE n3: ArrayLength
NODE n4: EqualEqual [B=0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Queue Empty"]
NODE n7: ArrayGet [Index=0]
NODE n8: ArrayRemoveIndex [Index=0]
NODE n9: GetDisplayName
NODE n10: PrintString
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Int]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n7.Array [Array]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n9.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.Value -> n8.Array [Array]
EXEC n8.Then -> n10.Execute
DATA n9.ReturnValue -> n10.InString [String]

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with actor array Targets. On BeginPlay ForEachLoop. For each, check IsValid. If valid print name. After loop print Done.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ValidCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: IsValid
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: GetDisplayName
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Done"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Input [Object]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n6.Target [Actor]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n3.Completed -> n8.Execute

prompts.instruction: Create a Blueprint with string array Inventory. On BeginPlay add Sword, Shield, Potion to the array. Then ForEachLoop printing each item. After loop print the total count.
prompts.expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BuildInventory
PARENT: Actor
VAR Inventory: Array<String>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Inventory]
NODE n3: ArrayAdd [Item="Sword"]
NODE n4: ArrayAdd [Item="Shield"]
NODE n5: ArrayAdd [Item="Potion"]
NODE n6: ForEachLoop
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: ArrayLength
NODE n9: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n4.Array [Array]
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n5.Array [Array]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n6.Array [Array]
EXEC n6.LoopBody -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.ArrayElement -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n6.Completed -> n9.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n8.Array [Array]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.InString [String]
